sentence.content: The National Union of Mineworkers said an estimated 200,000 black gold and coal miners in South Africa will begin a strike Sunday night for higher wages and better working conditions, in what it said would be the largest job action ever to affect the mining industry in that nation.

sentence.content: The strike initially would cover more than half of South Africa&apost;s gold mines and about one-fifth of its coal mines, said Cyril Ramaphosa, the union&apost;s general secretary.

sentence.content: If workers in mines not included in current negotiations join in sympathy strikes, a total of 300,000 miners could be on strike, he said.

sentence.content: The union&apost;s announcement produced little immediate reaction on South African financial markets, where analysts said a strike had been expected and probably wouldn&apost;t have much impact unless it lasted more than a month.
